definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: The research process and performance of high drop point fiber core grease were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 簡要介紹了高滴點鋼絲繩麻芯脂的研製過程及其性能。

sentences.english: High-drop-point lubricating grease is one of the ways of developing new lubricating greases.
sentences.chinese: 高滴點潤滑脂是潤滑脂的一個發展方向。

sentences.english: Could your eyes use some drop to clear up redness?
sentences.chinese: 你的眼睛可以滴點眼藥水來清除血絲嗎？

definition: to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to desensitize/to remove an allergic susceptibility
armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
to form a scar/to form a scab
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
